ResourceHeader.ResourceName: ACE Electron Proton Alpha Monitor (EPAM) Daily-Averaged Flux Data
ResourceHeader.Description: This descriptor identifies an ensemble of 26 data sets of daily-averaged, background-corrected energetic particle fluxes. Various data sets have fluxes that are: spin-averaged or spin-sectored; if sectored then from one of four telescope apertures (LEMS30, LEFS60, LEMS120, LEFS150); of ~63-4430 keV protons or ~40-360 keV electrons or 100-6500 keV/n Z>1 ions where any one of these energy ranges is partitioned into 10-25 energy bins; in the spacecraft rest frame or solar wind rest frame. Each of the 26 data sets is individually described in the VHO/VEPO interface at http://vho.gsfc.nasa.gov.

InformationURL.Description: The Explanation.html page at Fundamental Technologies (FTECS) describes how the numeric data from the Ulysses HISCALE instrument are divided into different print-groups (referred to as "data sets" above), the nomenclature of the ASCII-based comma-separated variable (CSV) files, and how those files can be accessed. Owing to their great similarities, "this file works for both EPAM and HISCALE." - TPA
